review_blob:
Very interesting IPA, big and boozy with Jolly Rancher like aroma, bright golden clear color with tiny head, some lacing. Palette is syrupy, above average mouth feel. Taste is caramel and lots of fruit, berry, Apple, melon us artificial sweetness. A dry finish with plenty of bitterness in aftertaste. I like it. Might go looking for a 6 pack. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Ballast Point Dorado Double IPA - Watermelon

review_blob:
Poured from a can. Thanks Kirk in FL. It's called a "coastal Ale" now. A pleasant malty aroma, easy drinking with a nice balanced sweetness and light hops. Bitter and dry in finish. Perfect a warm summer day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. can from brother Kirk. Pours a clear gold-amber with tall thick off-white head. Nose has citrus and lemon zest, grapefruit too; some floral herbal notes but fairly weak in aroma. First taste is tart citrus, grapefruit, bread and a bit sweet but with dry finish. Good hoppy flavor, not bitter. Palette is above average and creamy, round, soft. I like this; its a good every day IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Orange Blossom Back in the Day IPA

review_blob:
From 12 oz bottle in a shaker glass. Light gold mostly clear with tall white pillowy head. Leaving nice lacing. A little funky, some coriander and spice in the nose. Malt is very light biscuit, citrus hops. Taste starts with strong bitterness and then floral and fruit malt. Finishes with a good dose of piney tart bitterness. Not representative of the relatively low IBUs and ABV. Above average mouth feel with low carbonation. I like it, good easy drinking pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Allagash Beer Camp Myrons Walk

review_blob:
On tap at The Office Bar and Grill. Rich sweet whiskey and wood aroma, loads of caramel. Taste is on the sweet side, followed by the woody bourbon. Finishes semi-dry with plenty of tight astringent bitterness. Some alcohol burn. Tasty and pretty strong. Hard to find, but worth it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. can from my Florida brother. Very pleasant. Appearance is more dark orange than brown with off-white head. Chocolate, roast nuttiness in nose, nothing too pronounced. I might detect a bit of a tobacco note. We'll balanced taste, rich and toasty without being sweet. It has a nice fruity finish and subtle hop flavor. Above average mouth feel. A good easy to drink mild brown.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Bold City Dukes Cold Nose Brown Ale

review_blob: 12 0z. bottle. Pours an Amber-orange with generous pillowy off-white head and decent lacing. Aroma is somewhat musty and floral (from yeast?); its hard to pick up a hop character. I get a little bit of caramel maltiness. Taste is on sweet side with a metallic note, then some grassy and floral hop flavors come through. The finish has a pleasant herbal note balanced nicely with caramel. Not very much bitterness to speak of. Mouth feel is on light side with average carbonation. I like it as a session ale.
beer_name: Boulder Beer Hazed Hoppy Session Ale

review_blob:
12oz. bottle from a special mixed 12 pack. Pours clear bright orange-red with smallish off-white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with some floral highlights, then I get the rye spice as it warms with a  little toasted grain.
Taste is sweet up front with caramel malt flavors in middle. Finishes dry with  resin hops, tart and tight in aftertaste. Body was thinner than average, good tingle from carbonation in the middle. I like it!

500ml flip top bottle from Trader Joes, Milbrae, CA. Pours clear orange with modest off-white head. Nose is musty and skunky with a bit of cardboard. It is hard to pick up the malts and hops. I sense some cherry, stone fruit. As it warmed I picked up biscuity malt. Taste is pretty sweet and fruity with slight sour candy-like finish. Some bitterness and tannin in the aftertaste. Not sure I taste hops. Palate is medium body, oily feel, and average carbonation.

22 oz. bottle from City Beer Store in SF. Pours clear gold with almost no head. Aroma is sweet candy sugar and yeast, a little caramel and honey.
Taste is sweet and sour malt with spiciness from yeast. Has medium body, with slick mouthfeel, minimal carbonation. Spicy finish that lingers.
